Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the nature of the activity described in the consent form?
A) The activity is a commercial product survey with no research component.
B) The activity is part of a routine medical treatment plan, not a research study.
C) The activity is a recreational program evaluation, not related to research.
D) The activity is a research study comparing two mouth sprays for dry mouth treatment in cancer survivors.

Correct answer: D) The activity is a research study comparing two mouth sprays for dry mouth treatment in cancer survivors.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the research study involving two mouth sprays for post-irradiation xerostomia in head and neck cancer survivors?
A) To compare the taste preferences between two mouth sprays; B) To evaluate the effectiveness of two mouth sprays in treating dry mouth symptoms; C) To assess the long-term side effects of using mouth sprays; D) To determine the cost-effectiveness of mouth sprays compared to traditional treatments

Correct answer: B) To evaluate the effectiveness of two mouth sprays in treating dry mouth symptoms

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the total expected duration of participation for each subject in the mouth spray study?
A) 4 weeks; B) 6 weeks; C) 8 weeks; D) 10 weeks
Correct answer: B) 6 weeks

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding any additional costs for participating in the mouth spray study for post-irradiation xerostomia in head and neck cancer survivors?
A) Participants will be responsible for the costs of emergency treatment related to research injuries.
B) Participants will incur costs for the mouth sprays used during the study.
C) Participants will be charged for completing the surveys and pH testing.
D) There are no additional costs to participants for being in the study.

Correct answer: D) There are no additional costs to participants for being in the study.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What is the correct sequence of steps a participant will follow during the study period?

A) Initial survey, 2 weeks using Mouth Spray A, 1-week washout period, pH testing, 2 weeks using Mouth Spray B, final survey.
B) 1-week washout period, initial survey, pH testing, 2 weeks using Mouth Spray A, 1-week washout period, 2 weeks using Mouth Spray B, final survey.
C) 1-week washout period, pH testing, initial survey, 2 weeks using Mouth Spray B, 1-week washout period, 2 weeks using Mouth Spray A, final survey.
D) Initial survey, pH testing, 1-week washout period, 2 weeks using Mouth Spray A, 2 weeks using Mouth Spray B, 1-week washout period, final survey.

Correct answer: B) 1-week washout period, initial survey, pH testing, 2 weeks using Mouth Spray A, 1-week washout period, 2 weeks using Mouth Spray B, final survey.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the mouth spray study?
A) You will be required to pay back any compensation received; B) You will continue to be part of the study without using the mouth sprays; C) You will not be able to receive any medical care from the University of Pittsburgh or UPMC; D) You can stop participating at any time without affecting your relationship with the University of Pittsburgh or UPMC.

Correct answer: D

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many individuals does the study aim to enroll for the evaluation of the two mouth sprays for post-irradiation xerostomia?
A) 100; B) 150; C) 200; D) 250
Correct answer: B) 150

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
What is a potential risk associated with the washout periods during the study?
A) Increased risk of cancer recurrence; B) Greater amount of dry mouth symptoms; C) Severe allergic reactions to water; D) Permanent loss of taste sensation

Correct answer: B) Greater amount of dry mouth symptoms

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential benefit of participating in the mouth spray study for post-irradiation xerostomia in head and neck cancer survivors?
A) Guaranteed cure for dry mouth symptoms
B) Potential relief from dry mouth symptoms using the mouth sprays
C) Financial compensation for the cost of medical treatments for dry mouth
D) A permanent supply of mouth sprays for personal use

Correct answer: B) Potential relief from dry mouth symptoms using the mouth sprays

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
What are the alternative treatments for dry mouth symptoms mentioned in the consent form?
A) Prescription medication specifically for dry mouth; B) Continuing with current clinical team treatments, including over-the-counter sprays and frequent sips of water; C) Surgical intervention to increase saliva production; D) There are no alternative treatments mentioned

Correct answer: B

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes how your identifiable information will be handled in this study?
A) Your identifiable information will be shared publicly to promote the study.
B) Your identifiable information will be coded with a random ID number and only a select group of researchers will have access to the link between your name and the research code.
C) All your identifiable information will be stored without any form of encryption or security measures.
D) Your identifiable information will be directly linked to your survey responses and shared with all study personnel.

Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you experience an injury solely and directly related to your participation in the mouth spray study, what kind of treatment will be provided to you?

A) You will receive comprehensive long-term medical care at no cost.
B) You will receive emergency medical treatment provided by the hospitals of UPMC.
C) You will receive a fixed financial compensation to cover all medical expenses.
D) You will receive free medical treatment and additional financial compensation for any injury.

Correct answer: B) You will receive emergency medical treatment provided by the hospitals of UPMC.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you experience an injury directly related to your participation in the study, whom should you contact immediately for assistance?
A) The Human Subjects Protection Advocate; B) The Principal Investigator listed on the first page of the consent form; C) The sponsor of the research, TJA Health, LLC; D) Your personal physician
Correct answer: B) The Principal Investigator listed on the first page of the consent form

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form indicate about your ability to participate in the study?

A) Participation in the study is mandatory for all eligible patients.
B) You may choose to participate in the study, and you can withdraw at any time without any impact on your medical care.
C) Refusal to participate in the study will result in a penalty and loss of medical benefits.
D) Withdrawal from the study after consenting will result in a penalty.

Correct answer: B) You may choose to participate in the study, and you can withdraw at any time without any impact on your medical care.
